result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

made on 05-06-2015 - not signed by Court Official

Defendant Gwendolyn A Verstegen in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond continues  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  COMPLY WITH CONDITIONS OF THE ALCOHOL 24/7 PROGRAM. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.T.

D/C:  Defendant Gwendolyn A Verstegen in court, in custody.  Stephanie Ann Stauber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights - has copy of complaint.  Defendant requests court appointed attorney, not eligible for public defender.  Court grants petition for court appointed counsel.  Court waives right to counsel for bond hearing.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
